title.narrative: Improving the lives of small scale dairy farmers

description.narrative: This 30-month project is located in the provinces of Cotopaxi and Tungurahua, in Ecuador’s Highlands region. At this time, most families producing milk in the zone do no transformation or value added after milking and many deliver their milk directly to intermediaries who pay below the market price. This project is aligned with Component 1 “producing more and better” and particularly with Component 3 “marketing more and better” of the SumajMikhuna/Andean Eco Food regional program. The goal is to contribute to local socio economic development by building the inclusive dairy value chain, to increase farming families’ income by 25%. This will involve improving pastures and dairy cows; a gathering center will be implemented as well as two transformation centers, and an existing one will be upgraded; marketing circuits will be increased; technical skills and training will be improved and local employment will be generated. The project will address three key aspects: 1) Improving marketing by matching the supply generated with the demand from Ecuadorian dairy industries (Nestlé, Alpina, Reyleche, Indulac, Tony). At the same time, the project matches small-farmer products with short, diversified, local marketing circuits, such as agroecological farmers’ shops, fairs and markets. They will also match with urban sectors directly, through consensus-based supply / demand, to deliver baskets of small farmers’ products to families, schools, etc. 2) Developing associative gathering and transformation of surplus milk from participating families and rural organizations, complementing with improvement in the quality and volume of milk produced. 3) Strengthening organizations’ structure, administration and management of the microenterprises generated.
